review: Amazing food and honestly great service....WOULD RECOMMEND!!! The only downside is I would say the place is always busy but it's very understandable, they are an overall great place so make sure to make a reservation at least 10-15 mins before eating there just to skip the wait. The waitress we had very consistent with her visits to us about refills and any help we needed with payment or games on the little electronics on top of the tables. The food in general was amazing with the proportions being slightly bigger than expected meaning you get leftovers to take him with you!!!! Despite being a stupid teen along with my friend, not knowing how to pay, the staff was kind enough to help us the whole way through making our night...all-in-all this place is just great even with the amount of time you would expect it to take for your food to be prepared, if it weren't for a recommendation to try the place, I honestly would not have been introduced to the world of gourmet foods and what other better place than to go here if you haven't already!!! 10/10 rating!!!!                                                                      -Mikey

Disclaimer: I am recounting second hand good customer service as my boyfriend came home and immediately asked I write a good review for Red Robin because, "You're better at that kinda thing than I am." He wanted to pick up some burgers to go since we had a gift card. Ordering a to go order online gave us 20% off. Score. Utilizing the Red Robin royalty points got him an extra couple bucks off. Dope. Then once all discounts and gift cards were applied, he owed 47 cents. To which the employee helping him told him to not worry about it. Rad. Twas a merry night of savings, burgers, and kindness indeed.

BAR AREA REVIEW: Went shopping all by my lonesome in the Tyler Mall & got hungry. I needed to pass time until traffic passed anyway so I went to the ever reliable Red Robin's! Parking can be hard to find since this Red Robin is located in the mall area & it's always busy & crowded.  Sat at the bar area since it was only me & not a huge party. I saw others in as large a party of 4 get serviced quickly at the bar as well. I quickly got my order taken & got my food fast while watching a game on tv. Food is as usual great,; burger cooked to medium exactly how I like, & the server was quick to refill my drinks & fries as needed. I ate soooo much I waddled out of there with my food coma baby!! Wrapping up the meal was easy with an electronic kiosk device to pay on instead of waiting around to catch the waiter's attention for the check. You can basically pay (electronic kiosk turns green on top once you've paid) & get up & go! I can always count on Red Robin's for a decent burger when I've got a craving.

I came here because I didn't want to get poke bowl because last time it gave me the squirts. I was seated quickly by a sharp looking African American man (which was to my liking). I decided to get the $6.99 tavern burger because I'm a bit frugal. But the good thing was that it came with bottomless fries so I stayed there for about 2 and a half hours to take advantage of that AMAZING deal. The burger was ok. Just tasted like something I could've got at Burger King. I was so satisfied with my experience that I made my tip look like a smiley face(I tipped in coins) I attached a pic so you guys could see. Red Robinnnn YUMMMMM  -Peggy A.

Believe it or not, last night was my very first time dining at Red Robin. My husband and I split the Banzai burger and the Southern Charm burger and went for the steak and sweet potato fries. Both burgers were really good! I think the Southern Charm wins by a little bit but I'd recommend both of them. The service was great too. I'm not much of a burger lover but I'd happily come here again.

We came in on a Sunday mid afternoon for football! We went straight to the bar area for tv, beers, burgers, and sports :) Our waiter was friendly and prompt. Super nice and punctual. We got 2 burgers, a tower of onion rings, and a drink. He refilled our drinks and fries pretty consistently. Very observant and detail oriented! We will be back!

This place is really busy but the customer service is great. The manager was really nice. My sister mentioned the reason I didn't eat my burger (burned meat). I really like this place but I know things like this happen so, it's no big deal. I will definitely come back.

Stopped in for a quick bite on my way to meet friends..  The service was friendly, we were seated right away and within minutes our waitress was at the table making sure we all had our drink orders in and told us all about the appetizers  Out orders came out perfect and nice and hot. I love the food and service here.

Red Robin is a great place for gourmet burgers. Their menu never ceases to amaze me as there is always new burgers to try out. When I order a burger, I either like to have an egg in it, some avocado, or some barbecue sauce with some bacon in it. I've had:  -Royal Red Robin ( it has an egg in it and bacon... bomb..) - Whiskey River BBQ (Fried onions and bbq sauce) The latest time that I went I got the buzzed mac and cheese tavern. Burgers and mac and cheese? Sounds like a great combo. It was only 6.99 with bottomless fries. I thought it was okay. It is smaller than their gourmet burgers. The mac and cheese had an interesting taste, it was a little sour to me. But overall, it tasted pretty good. But I'm not sure if I'd order it again. I got bottomless sweet potato fries ( additional $1.29 but totally worth it)  I give this location 3 stars because of service. They have these new table kiosks to pay and potentially order as well. I feel like because of this, the waitress was a little less attendant to our table. It took a long time to get additional baskets of fries. This has happened before so this time once we got our burgers, we asked for another order of fries. And based on their slow time, it came out halfway as we finished our burgers and the rest of the fries. Additional baskets took a little longer. It was also hard to flag down the waitress.  The little machines gave us a little headache. It started malfunctioning after the second card swiped. It took a good 15 minutes for the waitress to help us and print us our receipts. I'd say a good third of our visit was just waiting, either for food to come or for assistance. Food is great nonetheless.

Came in for a quick dinner date on a Friday night and was seated by such a lovely hostess, Brooke! A+ customer service (and satisfaction!!!).  I ordered "The Wedgie" Burger which is essentially a protein-style hamburger (patties in between lettuce + guacamole, tomato, onions, and bacon) and it came with a side garden salad that I got with balsamic vinaigrette. Definitely a healthier option, but not any less tasty!  I've been to this location before (almost a 1.5 years ago) but my most recent experience was definitely much better overall. Our dining experience was up to par with my high standards!  In short: - Great service - Quick - Plentiful options for food & drink - $$/$$$$$

I got the Banzai burger and my wife got the Southern Charm burger. They were both awesome. We got bottomless fries, but they weren't brought out before the meal and they never brought a refill. I also didn't get a water refill til the end of the meal. I still feel like giving 4 stars based on how good the food was.

I love Red Robin but today's service was soo slow! Maybe it was a busy  Sunday lunch time but usually I can eat and leave without waiting for things like water or extra dressing. The turkey burgers are amazing and I love that I can use one in any burger they offer. And of course.. can't go wrong with cheese sticks!!

This place is worth it! Some of their burgers are about 8 dollars and comes with u limited fries. It really fills you up.  However the drinks r very syrupy and they do not mix your flavored iced tea for you. Before you take a sip, mix it unless you want a mouthful of syrup first.

I used to come in here all the time since it's my boyfriends favorite burger place. Service is usually slow, I'm assuming because they don't want to refill the fries too much. But we still come often. We came here the other night and when the guy brought me my soda there was something funky in it. I brought it to his attention and just said ew gross! he then brought me a new one, which I couldn't drink cuz I was feeling pretty disgusted. I was even more shocked when we got the bill and saw he still charged us for the drink. The least he could have done was taken it off the bill. It really makes me wonder how well they actually clean. I can sadly say I won't be able to eat here again
Good food but the experience I had today regarding the service was subpar. It's a shame because the new remodel is beautiful.

Me & my husband's favorite restaurant. They give really great rewards. So if you go here as often as we do definitely sign up for their rewards.  No matter what Red Robin you go the employees are always nice.
This place is always busy = the food is good. Service has been good every time. Sometimes the food can take a while but I attribute that to the amount of customers that are usually here.

My family and I had a great dining experience at this Red Robin yesterday afternoon. We ordered the 6.99 burgers with appetizers and then later a couple of desserts. The appetizers came out almost immediately and the food soon followed. The food tastes great, especially for the price and endless fries!  Our waitress was so sweet, attentive and even offered to go drinks for us before we left. We will definitely be back!
Good but not $6.00 Carl's Jr. good.  I rather buy a burger at Carl's Jr. Than here.  Save your money and buy a burger at Carl's.  You can overpay for strawberry lemonade if u want.
Great experience, Our server was really nice.. food was good , we got the $6.99 new tavern menu the Mac and cheese burger was on point. But we upgraded for the $8.99 one. Plus never endless fries .
Love the wedge salad and wings! Awesome price. There is a waiter there named Joseph nice looking sweet guy.  Yummmmmmm...

We stopped by after going to Castle Park so we were very hungry. They told us it would be a 30 minute wait & it turned into an hr & 15 minute wait. The only reason why we stayed was because the kids wanted to & it was one of their birthdays. The hostess' were disgustingly rude, I could hear them talking about our party, one rolled her eyes. While we waited a random family arrived & they asked the hostess question, as soon as the family walked away the girl started cursing at the other hostess and talked bad about the family. As we still waited my aunt asked the hostess a question about the wait and one of them got sassy with my aunt and called the manager which was no help either. I had my 2 month old sleeping in his stroller and they claimed that he was the reason why the wait was taking so long! We were only a party of 5, how hard is it to figure out where you guys want to sit us. After waiting over an hour we finally got seated, our server Jacob was outgoing, sweet & friendly unlike the other 2 rude girls. The manager then comes out & brings us complementary chips & salsa. My food was delicious & our server was great. If it weren't for the 2 dummies up in the front I would have given them a better rating. I won't be going back to this particular location, however I will be going back to my local Red Robin in Redlands, they have way better service.

I talked my daughter into having a burger...something she rarely eats...i felt sooo bad...hslf way thru the burger she had a mouth full if a long. Hair tangled up in the neat...nasty!!!!!...sure they comped the burger...they should have comped the while meal...my daughter was nauseated the whole night.   Disgusted!   Wear your hair nets!

Me and my boyfriend sat in the bar at red robin for our date night we ordered 2 tall blue moons a burger and a wrap. we loved our food,  and our service. Amanda was our bar tender and  she was awesome!

We eat here quite often but the last couple times they have fallen short. The chefs just can't seem to follow institutions. We ask for no sauce on the burgers and no salt on the fries but they simply can't help themselves. The most upsetting part is they try to scrape off the sauce instead of getting another bun, like we won't notice. The location in Orange gets it right every time. Come on guys, get it together.
Waited almost 2 hours just to sit my family down. Not happy with service.!!! Had family from Texas over as well and ruined their experience!

My friends and I dined in on Friday, we were sat near the kitchen when one of the bartenders and another employee were speaking negatively about a man sitting at the bar because he was "SO GAY". It is completely unacceptable for staff to be talking about their customers but especially about their sexual orientation, I'm not sure what this has to do with them or their job but I found it highly offensive, and I immediately wanted to leave, had my friends not already have ordered I personally would have left. I am very disappointed in the way this restaurants employees behave. This is about the third time I've been to this specific restaurant and had issues with the servers. I frequent the Chino Hills location and never have this issue I really hope that the employees will be talked to about this as it is completely unacceptable.  I will not be returning to this location.

I enjoy sitting at the booths in the bar area. I find the service is the best here. Especially from our server Brittney. She remembered us from a previous visit and got us things we needed even before we had to ask for them. She was awesome! I like coming to Red Robin because I know they are sentitive and courteous about my gluten allergy. Gluten free buns! Thanks for the great service Brittney.

Don't order 'to go' here. I ordered a simple little meal here for my lunch because I work at the mall. To start off it takes 10 minutes to get someone to pick up the phone. After placing my order, I go to pick it up 10 minutes later. After arriving at the resturant, I notice it's almost completly empty, giving no reason as to why it took so long for them to answer there phone. Speaking with the bartender, he looks up my order and tells me that my order was never placed!  It may not seem like a big deal but this isnt the first time its happened. The same exact thing happened to me about 3 months prior to that.  It really sucks, especially when your on a tight schedule, every second counts.
Our server was great and patient. The salad I ordered was good but the Italian dressing tasted nasty, it almost reminded me of the Wishbone dressing. Next time I'll order my salad dry
Great place to eat. Customer service was excellent food was well proportioned and very good. The bottomless fries are always a win win!!

5 stars for how a bad situation was handled. I ordered the Cesar wrap and half of it had absolutely no chicken. I informed the waitress and she was apologetic brought the manager out immediately without me having to ask. Of course I understood this was not any of their fault. Definitely the kitchen staff short coming. The manager was really sorry gave me a another wrap to go home and and a discount off our bill. Now that's how you handle a customer issue. I will definitely be back. The food was good just lack or zero chicken in my wrap. Other than that everything was great!

Told us it was a 30 min wait. Was more like an hour and a half. We asked around 30 mins and they said we were next and after that they gave about 6-8 parties a table before us. 2 of the parties had groups bigger than ours. Our waitress was really nice and the food was pretty good. Everything came out on time and overall it was a good experience, but it would have been nice if the people in the front would've told us how long we really had to wait

Beyond terrible service. Unprofessional staff with poor tone management and restaurant management overall. Went with my wife to pick up an order we placed online. It took 75 minutes for them to bring out our food after the original order was placed. When the food finally came out, it was ice cold and the staff poked fun about "see how busy we are... It's pretty crazy." They gave us an extra cup of fries and sent us on our way after a total of an hour and 45 minute wait. I don't want an extra cup of fries, I want my money back. Second round of food was thrown together in obvious spite from the requests for fresher food. Terrible experience. One of the worst I have ever experienced at a restaurant and I will never be returning to this establishment. Let alone this franchise. Retrain your staff. Especially on how to speak to customers.

Walked in and they were packed during lunch hours, sat in the bar section to get sitted faster because we were starving. Only one server was attending the whole bar section, so we did had to wait a while to get her attention for refills. The managers were attending customers as well. They had great customer service. The only thing I would prefer would be that after ordering, they would give us the side orders first so we could munch on it.
This place is awesome! From the beer to the food it is the best. Bartender Damien knows his stuff, and especially his beers. Will always come back here for a great meal and some beverages.
Very good service clean we had to wait for more then 20 minuts but i will come back for sure and i will let all my frinds and family know about this place

The Red Robin customer service team reached out to me promptly after my review and apologized for the experience and gave me a $15 gift card.  So my sister and I came back to this location and sat in the dinning area.  As mentioned before the food is good, and the server we had was good, she was very attentive and kept our drinks and sides refilled.  This visit was more in line to my first time at this location.
The BLTA on croissant tastes great! The waitress and hostess were both friendly and helpful.

They need to start taking reservations. Most people come to the classic dinner and a movie and its b.s. that you cant plan a proper evening out because your not sure if the wait will be 10 minutes or 40.

Enjoyed a great lunch for my birthday, the southern hamburger was delicious. Also had sweet potato fries and onion rings all were very good. Service and the waiters also good.  I had gone there to get Mud Pie for my birthday.... unfortunately it was made with chocolate instead of coffee ice cream. I should have look closer to the menu. It did say Mud Pie, but they should give it the correct name Mississippi Mud Pie which is made with chocolate ice cream.  Next year I will be more observant. They do have a lot of new food on the menu, still will go for lunch.....just not the Mud Pie. LOL
Good burgers, sign up for the loyalty program and get a free burger on your bday. Staff is friendly (with me atleast) fries are bottomless, milkshakes are really good

Tonight our server was Sonia. I think we saw her a total of 4-5 times during our whole visit. We only had 1 refill of fries. When our food finally came my four cheese melt was hard already and my sweet potato fries were cold. Then it took a little over 10 min for a water and root beer refill, no lie. And it's not even busy there is 4 tables on our side. I'll avoid this location from now on. Just very unsatisfactory service

I ordered a burger through door dash yesterday. It took forever to get here. (Not Red Robin's fault). When I got it it was soggy and cold. I called Red Robin and they completely accepted responsibility even though it was on the door dash people. The manager apologized and they even went way out of their way and personally delivered me a gift card to make up for my inconvenience. It is so refreshing to experience this level of customer service in today's world of dealing with computers and phones.... I didn't get the managers name but it was the kind and generous woman who was working on Friday 11/17 at 2pm. Whoever she is should not be the manager, but the DISTRICT/REGIONAL MANAGER!  She knows how to make a customer feel like they are important and appreciated. Thank you so much for turning a bad experience into an exceptional one. You have earned our business over here at Acura of Riverside and we will be ordering from you again 100%. GIVE HER A PROMOTION.

I came here lastnight, it was packed and had a wait time. The service could of been better. They werent really on top of their game that night well atleast the server I had wasnt.  I got a rootbeer float and the rootbeer didnt taste right at all. It was flat and bitter  instead of being sweetish. They were kind of skimpy on our fries and didnt care to give us refills.   The only thing that was pretty good was the dirty shirly temple and the fish.  If I come back I think I will try the teriyaki burger.

I went two months ago with my cousin. One a Friday night, it was crowded so we scored a table at the bar. Big mistake. Only one server was working the bar tables. Took forever to get our food and then he didn't bring us forks. My cousin had the fruit salad, which had some sort of sauce on it, making it too sticky and messy to eat by hand. Waiter was nowhere to be found. Eventually, she improvised and used the toothpick from her sandwich to eat the fruit. We didn't have napkins either, but thankfully I had a pack of Kleenex in my purse. We didn't get refills of our empty teas either. Of course he magically reappeared to drop off the bill. Came back on Tuesday for a late lunch with my mom. They're in the midst of renovations, so all the artwork is gone and they've got boards on the ground in the lobby area. They've switched to Ziosks, which is fine if you're like Chilis and are fully staffed. However, as multiple people have pointed out, this RR is too understaffed and now they've added Ziosks to avoid actually having waiters around.  Besides the 15-minute wait just for the server to come to our table and get our drink order, the food was awful and not well thought out. We each got a salad. I had the Avo-Cobb-O and the waitress said they were out of boiled egg. Um, why not make more? They take 20 minutes. Hell, the Target literally across the street sells them already boiled. From the time you opened until 3PM when I came in, could no one find the time to boil a few eggs? I saw a whole lot of standing around and laughing that suggests otherwise. The salads used to be served in a bowl, tossed already. Now, they come on a very long, narrow plate and the ingredients aren't even completely chopped let alone tossed for you. I had whole leaves of Iceberg in my salad. The chicken was in giant chunks that weren't completely sliced through. Trying to chop it up and mix the dressing with my salad resulted in a big mess. The stale, cold garlic bread on the side was the highlight of the meal.  This location needs to stop being cheap and get more servers out on the floor. On our most recent visit, the host had to run food and drinks because our server had 8 tables to deal with. Meanwhile, two managers (one male, one female) were at the pass, just chatting and having a great time. These Ziosks are not the answer. What good is a button to reorder drinks if I can see that the one and only server you have on staff is currently clearing off a table and then rushing back to the kitchen to pick up someone's order?  Stay away. Mediocre, old food and a long wait to get it. Edit: talked to the manager at the Corona location. She said the understaffing is a corporate thing. They're being given roughly a quarter of their usual hours and are being told to make it work. Yikes!

Great tasting food however meals and appetizers keep getting smaller. Got boneless wings and wedge salad. Salad was great and a good deal. Wings were laughable. Seriously pathetic. Manager said they weigh out amount of chicken they give you.  Seriously? Buffalo wilds is around the corner. They have slow service however if I'm in the mood for chicken wings they have my business. Someone's fuckn with the scale or I think they forgot to feed these chickens. It's bad when you spend $12 for lunch with a water and feel you should go to a fast food joint just to feel satisfied.  Left hungry and disappointed.  This place used to be one of my favorites. Quit being so damn cheap
We love it!!! This place is the bomb and our daughters love it as well. Nice service n very polite. It's the go to place to be chill and enjoy a nice meal and a cold one.

I love this place, table 81 is our table. Shakari was super nice and very attentive. Definitely will be back.  Bees knees is my favorite sandwich.  My 6 year old was very satisfied with his meal, which is a rarity.  Thanks again Red Robin.

Nice environment, decor. Waiter very nice.  But I go for the food bottomline. Were a family of 6 on a budget. Burgers for us are usually Bakers, the Habit, in & out, Islands, Carls, etc... We went here a few years ago & were not too impressed.   So when we got this coupon, I decide to give them another chance & treat ourselves to gourmet burgers. I got the burning love for about $12.  Any burger for that much should be a five or six Stars, Unforgettable, Melting in My Mouth, Extremely Uniquely Tasty & Delicious!  Again, the same disappointment as last time.  Mine was dry, no sauce, cannot taste the pepper jack cheese,  No Unique special taste!  it was not spicy or tasty really. It tasted like my husnands bbq, Ordinary. The meat was rubbery.  Not soft & delictable ( like the habits ). The original amt of fries you get are like 12.  Just because their bottomless doesnt mean you should be stingy on the first round. They were gone so fast & it took a long time to get the next round of 12. Haha!  So to leave spending 80-100 on these burgers is thievery.  My kids were like, " I like The Habit" better.    Thus, I will never waste my hard earned money on this place again.

Update: the interior design was recently changed, for the worst. Who was the person responsible? They probably are the person responsible for the over crowding at Disneyland, the hot weather in So Cal this week, and the reason Putin is so mad all the time, he probably is related to Kim Davis too. This location, was updated for the worst and there is no space, it looks tacky and not in a cute way but in I'm a burger joint trying to hard kind of way. The colors and reception at the front is strange, looks thrown together from the target design section. The menu and the dudes in the back cooking are the same.  Why did you change Red Robin.  Also new management has a very unfriendly demeanor.  Food is ok, but the atmosphere is poor.

This is a chain restaurant that deserves a lot of credit. I've been to several, and  always had a great experience. My favorite french fries of all time. These are the big steak fries that are crispy on the outside, and fluffy inside. And it's a bottomless basket. Hands down the best Fish and Chips I have ever eaten; A perfectly crisp, golden exterior, with delicious, flaky, white Cod steaming beneath. Great salads, Fantastic Burgers. Try the Reds Double Tavern Burger for under ten bucks, and the Tower of onion rings. Americana memorabilia adorns the walls. A great place for kids and adults. Half price appetizers during Happy hour. Full bar. Amazing, hard-working staff. Thanks for all the great Birthday Burgers over the years! Good job guys.

So Red Robin's is pretty much our favorite Riverside restaurant. Super family friendly.  The food is the best and of course service is an +A. Jacob was our server today and never once let us down. We will always come back. Not to mention we are Red Robin royalty members that gives you great discounts!

What a total change!! I hadn't been in a little over about over 2 years and I must say they have downgraded. The burger are smaller then I remembered, and if they're going to offer bottomless fries, the server should be more attentive to that! Mike was our server, very hard to track to down. We waited quite some time for our French fries, so my burger got cold from just waiting. My fault though. The food was good, but it just wasn't what I was expecting. Up the service more! Our first choice was the habit across the street, perhaps we should of gone there

Boo, hiss, Delaynie's reviewing a chain. The benefit of my heresy is that you know what to generally expect from a Red Robin. Moving on!  The service is pretty good here if you sit in the bar area. Food comes out quickly, even if drink refills are a little slow. Red Robin Happy Hour stinks even though they advertise it everywhere, but that's not this location's fault. I appreciate the promptness and efficiency of service here, since I've spent a combined total of 40% of my upbringing waiting for my check in other Red Robins.  Also, I would be remiss not to mention bottomless fries (or broccoli, if you hate yourself) in all their salty glory.

The food and service here is, overall, pretty good. Only a few times have we had an unattentive server at this location. Because my fiancé and I usually come here after work on Fridays, there is a bit of a wait, but being a party of two, we get get seated fairly quick, usually at one of the small tables by the bar. The food is delicious, I've never had any major issues with their food, and it's delivered in a timely matter most od the time. I will say their California Chicken Burger tends to be a bit dry, on more than one occasion, so I've stopped ordering it altogether. More often then not,  my order is completely correct, though they sometimes forget my customizations, though as it's usually "no tomato/pickles", it's not the end of the world for me to have to take it off myself. It's when I ask for extra bleu cheese on my Bleu Ribbon burger that it upsets me when they forget. I mentioned earlier that we often sit at the small tables by the bar. They are really small, and the table gets really crowded. It doesn't help when you have this big ziosk on your table, which I absolutely love using, but it's just more in the way on such a small table. The tables are close together too, so your chair and the person behind you may be bumping into each other. Overall, great chain restaurant, only minor issues on occasion.

So my wife and I used to frequent this particular Red Robin weekly. The manager and staff were amazing, we formed a close bond with Tammy the main manager because she always took great care in making sure my wife's unique order was handled safely, she has celiac and chrones so everything has to be handled very carefully.. Since Tammy has left management other than tremaine who we also love has gone down hill.. Tonight we were greeted by a guy in a cowboys jersey who was more concerned with the game then actually greeting us. Our waitress was great, Jasmine did an awesome job handling our party of 8'(celebrating moms bday).  Things really went down hill tho when I was about halfway thru my avo-Cabo salad when I found an incredibly long and nasty hair.. Jasmine was mortified and took it right back to have another one made.  The second try came out and this time instead of a piece of hair I noticed an all black (actually multiple black) pieces of avocado. At this point I just gave up and stopped eating all together.  The manager I think named Stephanie Didn't seems concerned with the fact that i hardly touched the second try.  Instead she came by and casually dropped off a "free appetizer" or dessert coupon and said, "for the trouble" ummmm, the least you could do was take this one item off the bill that was already close to $150!!! So unprofessional, we likely will go out of our way to the Rancho Cucamonga location from here on out.  Process with caution at this location

Oh my goodness the worst place I have gone by far. We asked for two burgers mead/well and we get charcoal burgers. I tell the waitress they are over done and to please replace them because they are not edible. After she leaves another lady comes with the replacement burgers and says ok here are your burgers and I ask her the mead/well and she said "yes no pink". Ummm noo I want some pink but it's fine I don't want to waist food we can take them. So I'm not sure who she was but I'm assuming she was the manager only because she had a different color shirt. I'll let her slide because maybe she doesn't cook but how do your cooks not know what mead/well is. I was very disappointed no one ever apologize nor did the manager introduced herself to show that she cared. I definitely won't be going back to that location.
Good burgers like always! Sat near the bar to watch the game but the bar seats are somewhat uncomfortable.
Best Burgers anywhere. Wow the flavor the quality the service all excellent 100%  im a repeat customer for the MadLove Burger

I we'll never returned in this restaurant. I can't believe they ripped me off after giving them tips. If only I had checked my receipt & I would have asked why I was charge for Entertainment Fee? I meant I wasn't really Entertained, is not like they sing in our table or something! They just took orders and served our foods . Nothing really special. The food was okay, old bacon & saggy onions rings. Next time explained to your customers for any charges that's not on the menus would much appreciated.

Upscale service at bargain prices!   This Red Robin is set apart by their amazing service and staff, in particular Cindy (who usually is in the bar section).  Due to work, I'm there about once a month and Cindy remembers every unique detail of my order and it's always perfect. You can get work done since it's not to loud.  The restaurant is clean, parking plentiful, and very reasonably priced.

My husband and I ate here last night on Veterans day.  I LOVE that they offer free food for Veterans on Veterans day!! My husband was very excited for his free burger.  This retaurant is always clean and the staff is very friendly!! I would highly reccomend this place.. and the chicken ensanda platter is perfection!

So being the first time I ever went to red robin the experience was very sub par and below my expectation. The wait was nice, they said i would have to wait 50 minutes and we actually  waited about 20 so that was cool. But   as far as the food goes it was alright nothing special. The experince that really ruined it for me though was that afterward I got food piosoning and was throwing up all night afyerward. So for my first time going the experince was meh not really that great, i dont really think ill be going back any time soon.

I just wanted to say the waiter we had was nice but then became a little to nice to my fiance. I find it very inappropriate to write on the receipt love Ami to a family man. Just wanted to throw that out there. Just do your job and that's it. Food was great like always.

I don't normally have issues with Red Robin and I try to take into account busy days and whatnot, but today was a little frustrating. I had ordered a Prime Chophouse burger with sweet potato fries. 10-15 minutes later they came back, they got the sweet potato fries right, but was given Prime Rib Dip. Told them it wasn't what I ordered and waited another 5-10 minutes with 3 or 4 people telling me my order was coming up. Finally received my burger but got normal fries. Having waited a long time and having to be somewhere, I just accepted what was given because I was tired of waiting.

I took my mother out to dinner there that's what she requested because they have gluten free menu and she wanted a hamburger .. the waiter said she couldn't have the seasoning on the fries cause it has gluten in it.. the manager brought out our food and I notice some black speckles on her fries and I asked what it was the manager said it was from the grease in the fryer I tried the fries and it had the seasoning on them and the manager still insisted that it wasn't the seasoning so he got upset with me and said he will go make them himself and he brought out new fries and they looked different and tasted like a fries with out seasoning ... I just wish the manager would have just owned up to his mistake and be thank full he didn't make his Customer really sick

Hadn't been to this red robin until yesterday when I went for lunch. I was surprised by the decor inside that it was so kid friendly, but it was probably only this Red Robin. The food was great and their bottomless fries are always amazing. The portions for the fries when you first get them with your burger are small which has you bugging the waiter who never really seems to come around to your table. That was the only thing that puts them at 4 stars, their service. Other than that, great food.
Worst burgers ever! Would never recommend this place. I got the blue & black burger. VERY small for $15.00 and the fries were cold. Burger was terrible and the bun was a joke. Service was just ok.

This location always has a wait. Perhaps because it's at the mall. I came to this location about 3 times. Servers are usually pretty good but they always always forget to give us napkins!!! And they always take forever to come back around! As for the food, I have always loved red robin burgers since I was little. Specially their unlimited bottomless fries. The wait for the food is also a little long but they are always busy. We came for Veterans Day lunch and they gaved my boyfriend a red double burger which was a value of $6.99. They also gaved him a card to thank him for his service which all the employees had signed. Which was very thoughtful. I got the smoked and pepper finest burger which I really liked. It comes with a side of peppered ketchup. I usually get the whisky burger but I wanted to try something new. This place is close to home so we come here and there when we craving some bottomless fries.

This star is for service not food. I come this Red Robin all the time but this last visit was by far my worst. I had someone named Victoria serving me and she was quite rude. I saw her on her phone instead of coming to make sure our table was taken care of. She had thee worst attitude. If anyone comes to this location and your put in her section definitely ask for a different server.

We've come here a few times before and the food has always been good. I probably would have given this place more stars if it wasn't for the rude hostess at the beginning of our visit. Rachel was super sweet and quoted us 20 minutes to which we agreed to and took a seat in the waiting area. We started to notice smaller groups that came after us being called before us, which we understood because they were busy and we were a group of 5. When we noticed that another person from the same name had been called we simply asked if it was our group to which a new hostess Hannah, replied rudely "We're still waiting on a booth for you guys (we hadn't specified which we preferred) you were quoted 30 minutes and it has only been 12". All she had to say was that they were still waiting for a larger table for us. There was also a manager standing right next to her who said nothing about the rudeness. We would have gotten up and left if it hadn't been for Rachel calling us once again to seat us. Our server was great and the food was good but when I approached a manager with my complaint he didn't seem all too concerned. I work customer service as well so I understand rude customers,  but we weren't. We were simply asking a question. I understand that everyone has bad days but you are being paid to give your customers a good experience. We paid a lot for our food so I just feel like we should have been treated better. Had the manager cared a little more I wouldn't feel the need to write this review but here I am. All in all it would have been an okay experience had Hannah's horrible customer service and the managers indifference not ruined it for us.

They are getting ready to cut staff it seems. The manager insisted on showing me their self serve tablets. They are on every table. My waitress was awesome, but I am really disappointed in these new tablets. Horrible!!! They just lost a regular :(
Omg, Brooke is an amazing person. Super kind and helpful! Really nice and really helped with refills as well made my experience beautiful. Thank you, Brooke

I enjoyed our lunch here. I was a lot later then the rest of my party and the staff didn't make a fuss. They seated my party and  patiently waited for my arrival. When I arrived, our waitress was very helpful and her service was good. Only complaint was she could have came and checked in us a little more (we needed refills). But I understand it was very busy.

Haven't been to a RR in many years, but even better then I remember. Glad the food shows up on a plate now. Never liked baskets. Service was excellent, food delicious. Parking sucks, but that isn't their fault :)

I went today for the first time and I must say I was extremely disappointed. I went there on a date thinking it would be a great place to get some good food and a friendly atmosphere. The food was good and that's the only reason I give it two stars. I would give zero stars for their customer service. It was almost towards the end of our dinner and our server had placed a pitcher of water on the bar and when he closed the door leading into the bar the pitcher fell and water got everywhere including on me. It wasn't a few drops but if not I got my glasses wet, my arm, and my shirt. I was really embarrassed because customers were laughing and instead of the server that spilled it coming up to me and apologizing for what he did he stayed at the bar and yelled "I'm sorry" but was not sincere. He saw me drying myself off and didn't bother to even offer me a towel or even more napkins. I found it completely rude and unacceptable that he never once came up to me to apologize for what he did. He just blew it off as if it was no big deal. I understand hat accidents happen but working in the service industry you make sure you go up to someone and apologize and try to make things right especially if you spilled water on them because they were being careless. After all that we were waiting for our check and it never came. I had to pay with my card because I just wanted to get out of there asap. I was astonished by how poor service I received and this is my first and last time I ever come to this location. It's saddens me to know that this place has good food but employs people that don't care. I am not expecting to get anything out of it but a sincere apology was the least that could have been done. I wouldn't recommend anyone come here and I know this restaurant has lost my business as well others that ask me about this place. I hope management fixes this issue and makes sure that this never happens again.

Update:  They sent me a $20 gift card, I went again and had a different experience, the food was savory, I had the genesis burger it was delicious, food and drinks came fast, everything was amazing!  the service was ok, attributing it to the server being quite young and inexperienced from what we could tell, but got right on what we requested: fries and refills. Thanks! Changing to 4 stars because they just fall a little short.  Seating time: 10 minutes Drinks: 2 minutes Food: 5 minutes Flavor: not savory at all, my bf and I both ordered the smoke and pepper. Our fries were not bottomless, the waiter brought us a small batch but never refilled or asked if we would like more, our drinks were supposed to be bottomless, again never received a refill. His service not great at all. He didn't check up on us or if we needed anything, other waiters didn't either even after stopping them to ask for something.  Check: 20 minutes just to get it to our table.  Needless to say, disappointed.

I was so excited to have a guacamole burger. Well, the guacamole is just a spread and a very light amount of spread. WHAT THE HECK! When I splurge on a burger I want what it's called. The waiter Matt was AWESOME and he asked if I wanted the burger a little pink or no pink. I said "No pink." That is NOT how it came out. It was pretty pink. I was very disappointed and now I know where I won't be going anytime soon. I do want it known, Matt was great. He wasn't the one to prepare the food.

Horrible service and our server was soooo inattentive!!! Every time she asked us something- she wouldn't wait for the answer- and would assume we were going to answer the opposite of what we did. Got my order 100% wrong . And had to wait while my order was remade- horrible and it got brought out way too fast the second time- hmmmm spit in my burger? Probably ! Update: shittiest burger I've ever ate!!!! Super dry!!!

We were shooting a film in town and needed a filling meal for our cast and crew. Traimaine and her staff went above and beyond to help. As soon as we arrived with the burgers and fries everyone said "Yumm", happy to have had a delicious meal.

I always get the same thing when I go Red Robin, a banzai burger. It's a teriyaki burger with a pineapple inside as well as your usual tomato, lettuce etc. I am always extremely pleased with the service here as well. The servers are always so friendly and attentive (your drink never goes empty here). Always a pleasant experience

This was the worst experience I've had at this location.  When we went it was really busy which isnt an issue for me. im a pretty patient person.  The service started just fine. Sit down, order drinks, order some appetizers. Then we ordered our burgers. Me and my wife got boca burgers and the rest of the family got the classic style patties. Our patties came out nuke warm which happens sometimes with the bocas. I was starving and didnt really mind. My mother likes her meat well done to forget that it was once bleeding and found a little pink. So she sent it back and ended up getting a hockey puck in its stead. The manager was very compensating and apologetic but the kicker of it all was they forgot about my brothers birthday after being reminded a few times and singing to other guests around our table. Very dissapointed.
Great food, & excellent service. We were there on a Friday during dinner peak hours & Rockey was our server. She was very attentive
Best Waitress Ever Award Goes To . . . . Johnnie!  Food was delicious, but service was amazing.  Thank you!!!!  You made my daughter's 25th birthday lunch perfect.

Food is pretty great, but my review is more directed towards the service. Im glad R.R. offers a bun alternative. I got a lettuce bun on a Prime chop burger with a side of Garlic fries. Pretty good. This being our first Red Robin experience we are leaving Very satisfied. Rocky was our Waitress and is a Gem. She was friendly, attentive, and pleasant. She was sweet to our 3 boys and made sure we left with balloons to boot. She has a genuinely positive personality. Service is 75% in my book. Thanks Rocky! We will be back.

Me & my girlfriend went to this location for lunch today an I notice that the store was a mess now it was busy & maybe I'm being a stickler but our sever Brandon made the stay worth while & I also notice that the young manager on duty was working tables as well  she did stop by our table & made small talk not know that my girlfriend is a server as well !!!! Let me say the food & service was excellent my only concern was the way the store was presented .

We come here for the onion rings and happy hour. $350 beer and they have a lot of TV's. Family atmosphere the burgers are okay. Just don't have bacon on them. Service is always good, sometimes the wait can take long but once we get sat it's good service.

A first here, by invitation. Saturday lunch and the place was moderately busy. The ambiance was urban light and the noise level is low.  So we ordered from their 'Finest' menu. I got the DGB (Damn great burger,if I remember it correctly) of 1/2 lb perfect medium rare Black Angus Beef topped with a delectible combination of delicious oven-roasted tomatoes, very fresh arugula and roasted garlic aioli tossed in citrus olive oil dressing all bunned in toasted ciabatta. I liked the whole combination,delicious and nutritious. I got fresh salad with bleu cheese dressing for the side, instead of the bottomless steak fries. Overall,my meal was a good gourmet. My partner ordered the Black and Bleu burger. Medium rare 1/2 lb Black Angus Beef with sauteéd and blackened Portobello mushrooms,grilled onions,their own bleu cheese sauce, bleu cheese crumbles all in a toasted ciabatta bun and a side of Dijon sauce. His side of bottomless steak fries was crispy and fresh. He didn't like it and he's the one who used to eat here a lot.  Our server Matt was very attentive. Great service! I will definitely come back!

I dunno why people are complaining!! The service ... AMAZING!!! If anything.. Ask for Victoria.. She's amazingly attentive.. Brings napkins, refills , and stops by like no other! She even asks if you want to take home refills!! I mean wow!! The food was whatever ... Lol OMG!!! My bf and I came and ordered a Burger and Victoria asked if we were going to share it.. We said yes.. And it came out cut in halves!!
I love red Robin I come here to get the chicken wrap which is amazing. And their happy hour is always. I love when a large chain like red Robin offers drink and food specials for the customers

So me and my friend came here nobody was at the front so we waited as more ppl started to come in we're all standing there waiting finally someone comes and she's apologetic about it so we let it go...anyways we sit at the bar and the ppl that came in after us do too both of us are just waiting and waiting finally... the party that came in after us leave but me and my friend press the button for our server on the little computer they have on the table but we're still waiting then finally some chic with a buzz cut comes up to us throws us out menus I wish I was exaggerating but she literally threw the menus on the table turned the flashing light off the computer and walked away I never felt so disrespected by a waitress before she needs to have a pep talk about her attitude or consider another field because customer service is not her specialty anyways me and my friend leave and go sit on the dining side because I was ready to give her a piece of my mind about her Nasty attitude. But on a better note our new waitress was awesome she's the only reason for this star she made jokes suggestions about the food she was amazing the food was good nothing to brag about would I be back? meh but if I ever get that buzz cut waitress I will definitely request another waiter

This red robin is decent. I've always liked their burgers here. They also have a huge selection of drinks. Seating is kind of tight inside especially when it's busy due to being in the mall. Service can be hit or miss here. Have had good waiters and some that seemed like they weren't sure what was going on. Still prefer coming here over other places in the mall as they have decent prices and a good selection of food and drinks. Their new pads they have at the tables are an awesome idea. You can call your waiter using it, pay your check and order appetizers among other things. It really helps make the dining process more streamlined.  Wish more places did this because it would help when the wait staff is super busy.

All good for us. Hubby loved insane romain salad. I got shroom burger, protein style, with turkey patty and broccoli. (Proud of me) lol, sure I miss the fries, but....gotta get healthy! Thanks for making that easier  now apply my coupon and we're all happy
The quality of food was not that great. Service was okay. The fries were greasy beyond greasy and the color and quality showed. I don't think I would come here again.

I was just at this location it was pretty quiet in there the waitress niki was coughing when my husband and I sat down.she then took our order burger and fires and a tap beer fries came out cold I had to ask for fresh hot fries she did not apologize ! She when my tap beer came out before my food it was warm I gad to send it back and ask if I could have it cold with my food. I was disappointed with the service love red robin but I dont  tnink I will be going back to this location know time soon. I thought becouse it was kinda empty service would be better whelp guess not.

So I've never been to Red Robin before. My little one recieved a certificate from school so I said what the hell let's go, and since I knew that I was going to go to Red Robin I didn't had lunch. So we walked in hostess took our name down told us about 20 mins we said cool we wait. Now 40 pass by and I'm pist since I had no lunch. So finally 50 mins later I approached the manager told her I've waiting for 50 mins and people with part of 5, 3 or 7 been called and they were after us. I have kids they are hungry too. She find us a table. Lobby is small, bearly can fit 10 people. Other host dude remind me three-toed sloths , slow and he was whispering guest name

Amanda was awesome! We sat in the bar and she made us perfect drinks and always made sure our table was satisfied! Good and service amazing she was really sweet and is very efficient in the bar and working tables. Have a good one!  Thank you girly  -Korie and Anthony
I'm never disappointed with the food, or the service. And can always expect to leave satisfied.

I've been craving a burger for weeks now... and while Red Robins is not what would usually come to mind, I happened to be at the mall, so I thought that i would give it a try. I sat at the bar, since I was dining solo, and just wanted to make it quick.  My burger-- something smoky with BBQ was great! The fries were good, too.  My problem was with the service, which I am hard pressed to complain about... the only reason i feel qualified to complain is that everyone around me got great service!  After my food came, I had to wait over five minutes or so to ASK for napkins... I knew i was gonna spill that delicious burger... but I could not get anyone's attention. I also asked for honey mustard, and it was never delivered, so I had to ask the bartender.  But what really annoyed me was how long it took to pay my bill--- I had actually planned on leaving only 15% tip, and not my usual 20%, but I needed change, so I was waiting for my card to be picked up. So I waited, and waited, and waited... and after 15 mins or so, I had to use the bathroom and just wanted to leave... so I just threw my bigger bill in (and gave over 20 %), when I got back from the bathroom, the money was still waiting there! I could have totally just walked out without paying!  Maybe it's because I was alone, but the people on both sides of me had great service, so I knew what I was missing.

It's a typical Red Robin. Recently remodeled, they've added some artistic barriers to cut down on the noise, which is nice. In my experience, the food comes out quickly and is always good. One star down because sometimes it's tough to track down a server when you need a refill, but that's to be expected at a busy restaurant.

Came here on a Friday night with the boyfriend. I got a bacon cheeseburger & my man got clucks Mac & cheese. I really don't remember the name of it to be honest. We were told 15 minute wait but got seated pretty fast. Our server was really nice. Always made sure our drinks were refilled & that we were taken care of. Overall I enjoyed my time there, food was good wasn't like "OMG" but pretty good. I would come again :)

I really like me some Red Robin! I eat here a lot, and I love the food to death, but sometimes the service is lacking. Don't get me wrong, there are times it is super, but more often than not it's hard to grab a waitress or waiter if you need something. I will always keep coming back though cause the burgers are so good. Can we bring back that beer cheese brat please? ;)

Peach tea is amazing, and there's unlimited refills! I ordered the Banzai burger, and it was pretty good but I just wish there was more teriyaki or a stronger flavor to it. You can ask for more teriyaki on the side if your burger doesn't have enough. Next time I'm going to go for the bacon avocado burger :3 You can't go wrong! I like that you can order your patty sorta pink. It keeps the meat really tender, and oh so delicious!

Good was good and yummy. The waiters here are nice. Presentation of the food changed a bit so be cautious when ordering your favorites or new items without pics. Management seems like they take care of customers if there is anything wrong. Good service and quick when packed house.

Ordered pick up twice and both times the order was wrong.. Ordered a black and blu burger and magically get the wrong order yet again.. Called ahead so I wouldn't have to wait and still waited over 15 min for a small order to be completed..
First time ! Food is good , service is good , we got free extra fries :-) Oreo shake is really good ! Server rocky rocks

Our family decided to have dinner here tonight in hopes that we would have a great meal and good service. As we entered the restaurant we were immediately greeted and seated. The hostess was nice and informed us that a server would be with us shortly. While waiting we notice our surroundings were nice, good sports decorations and overall nice atmosphere. After a 15 minute wait, we were finally greeted by our server who said "I'll be right w/you". After another 5 minute wait she finally took our drink & meal order.  We got the feeling that they are under staffed tonight because service time was really slow. Management needs to improve this lack of service or customers will not be returning. The only plus to the lack of good service was that the food quality was good!

Entree #1 Pork ribs 3.5 Amazing pork ribs soaked in BBQ sauce, cooked well however it was drenched in so much sauce that I feel like I was eating out of the bottle of BBQ sauce. Mac and cheese 2.0 The cheese was thrown on top of the macoroni and heated. It became hardened and difficult to chew. It was my biggest dissappointments because I always thought there's no way you can go wrong with Mac and cheese ! Cole slaw 1.0 No comment. It was bagged cabagged sprinkled with sauce. Fries 1.0 It was tasteless, practically potatoes wedges. Soft and soggy. I ate one fry and fed the rest to my dog. Lemonade 4.0 Love the lemonade. You can't go wrong with that !! Except it was fountain and was no freshly squeeze. However, it was still satisfying. Crisp spicy chicken salad 4.0 Love this plate it was as good as the lemonade !! There were bits of boiled eggs, cheese, chopped tomatoes, and deep fried chicken. Service 4.0 Our waiter was drew. He did a fabulous job when he could and I understand that since he was the only one working that night and the bar, occassionaly memory slips occur.  Price 3.0 Our bill came to the amount of $45 for two including tips. I think that with that amount I could have definitely purchased better quality food.

I'm giving 5 stars because they serve some great burgers and their bottomless fries are super delicious. I got the Double Tavern which is a smaller burger but still worth it. It's actually a pretty good deal at $6.99. Thousand Island sauce. Double meat. All the fixins. I was not disappointed. The Colossal Burger was not as yummy. It was still good but there wasn't enough brisket on it to take it that extra mile. The waiters are always fast and attentive. The place is always clean. The noise level is average.

My girlfriend and I were out shopping and found we were hungry. We decided to try this new Red Robin location.  My girlfriend ordered a cheeseburger and fries. I order the $5 wing and chips combo. I had icea tea and she had peach iced tea. My wings came with the buzzard sauce. It is your typical buffalo wing sauce. I had ranch on the side. The wings were served on top of the chips so most of them were soggy with wing sauce. The waitress brought me a side of wing sauce and a separate side of chips. The chips were lacking in flavor. My girlfriend polished off her burger and fries. She declined more fries. I spent about $8.  I doubt I would order the wing chips appetizer again. The burgers are great however.

We love Red Robin but this location was a disappointment. VERY dirty plates. Spring Chicken sandwich came cold. Avo-cabo salad did not taste fresh. Chicken on both items seemed as though it was cooked hours prior.  Fries were good.

The cobb salad was not good, it was a very sad salad, no boiled egg either. My seafood scatter was decent, but the fish was overcooked. Service was nice, but couldn't save the food. Probably won't be back, I don't even like Red Robin, why do I come here?

$5 AMF & LA Waters? That's a four stars itself! I personally wish they put more alcohol in these drinks because it tasted water down. However, it's still good. I personally really like the customer service here. I have been to Red Robins countless times, especially in NorCal SJ because that's where I used to live. I gotta say, I have never experienced such a good customer service for all the times I've visited a RR. Also, their food comes out A LOT faster! Our waiter was the best, he waited no time to bring us extra order of fries so we wouldn't have to wait. He refilled our drinks & helped us with all our concerns extremely fast! As for food, I think all RR restaurants tastes the same so it all really comes down to customer service and the quality and quantity of the food. Unfortunately this location kind of skim us on the fries because our fries literally had 7 pieces...  but regardless, pretty good location! Quick wait time, cheap drinks, and excellent customer service!

Normally I go to the red robin in Redlands but I was near the Tyler mall so I decided to give it a try. Definitely liked the intimate space I got at this location However, I was not impressed with my fries or my order of cheese sticks with jalapeños , basically anything that was fried tasted and looked like it had been fried in old oil which is not great. I usually look forward to my basket of fries but I was disappointed at this location.

Service was good. One flaw was our plates looked dirty. .. it was off putting. And my husband's burger bun was soaked in grease. Which they said was the dressing ... but we know what ground beef looks like. Don't think we'll come back to this red robin.

We have been here many times.  Every time we come here we have great service and the food is great.  Especially the hamburgers.  This time I had the Bonzai hamburger.  It has a variety of things on it, including a pineapple.  It tasted great and the hamburger was cooked "medium" just the way it should be cooked.  This time when we visited, there was a 30 minute wait.  However, the secret is to sit at the bar.  You get served by the bartender right away.  I had a beer with my hamburger and buy was it good.

By far, the worst tableside experience from a restaurant. I guess they have these new tablet things and you're supposed to do everything from that tablet and if you don't you're screwed. The waitress never returned to our table and we didn't receive half the food we ordered. Waste of money and time.

Received some of the worst service. Our waitress (I'll spare the name out of respect) was horrible. She took forever to take our order, never checked on us, we had to flag her down to get any type of assistance, and she even rolled her eyes at me when I asked for a to go box. We sat in the bar area and we were one of three tables being occupied at the time so there is no excuse for the lack of attention. She was too busy flirting with the bartender behind the bar! Even when we got a refill on our drink she left the empty cup after looking directly at it. Thank goodness the food was good. Saved my experience from a complete and total loss. Can't say I'll be back any time soon. I'll drive all the way out to corona if need be.

Ive came here 4 times over the past several months. The first three times, I was waited on by a girl named 'Cindy' (or cyndy, I dont remember). Each time I was served by Cindy, it was atrocious. She has a really terrible attitude and is slow. Shes also forgetful and is nowhere close to pleasant.  Now I went last night, hoping to change my luck with this place. I asked to not be seated in Cindy's section, and the hostess was very understanding and told me Cindy wasnt working tonight. She went on to tell me that tonight's crew was really good and I should be fine.  The food is always great here. Red Robin's 'bottomless' options make this a place to go to for drinks. Speaking of which, they have a LOT of drinks and dessert options. Most notably, the pumpkin Shake was the best pumpkin flavored thing I have ever had. Yes, seriously. The freckled lemonade is decent.  The service was worlds better with my service tonight than with 'Cindy'. I forget her name now, unfortunately. She was really nice, and efficient.  I probably wouldve gave this location 5 stars had it not been for 'Cindy', but long as you avoid her, you will be okay coming here.

we get seated the server was rude her facial expressions looked like she hated her job! we order food she never came around to ask if we needed drinks as soon as our food got here our fries were super cold our sandwiches were missing bacon the avocado was ugly and our croissant was super hard I will never come here again, money was not well spent!
Worst service ever had to call the boss multiple times in order to get refills and to even get back the change from my bill.

Writing this as my family and I are finishing our lunch. The food was phenomenal! Had the Sauteed Shroom burger. It was delicious! Sweet potato fries, delicious! Our waitress Rocky was on point and catered to our needs. She was very pleasant and just an all around enjoyment to have as our waitress. This establishment was very clean, from the tables and floors, to the bathroom stalls and doors. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to have a wonderful meal in a clean relaxing environment!

Came for a quick drink and appetizer's as a co worker was leaving. Good drinks, good appetizers. Loved the deep fried pickles, the chips with the chicken wings were kind of soggy and the tavern fries, really could have used shredded cheese vs a slice of sandwich cheese on our fries.
Great burgers and other food. If you are gluten sensitive this is a great place to eat. they have a pretty wide variety of GF foods to choose from.

For a chain restaurant type place, you can't go too wrong at Red Robin.  Consistent food.  Good service for the most part.  We always get the red robin burger, garlic fries with extra garlic, crispy chicken salad, and I could almost drink the honey mustard

I understand that gimmicky chain restaurants usually have subpar food due to the fact that they have chosen to appeal to a classes, tasteless, genuinely American suburban clientel, but this particular location took it to a new low with their Southern Charm burger. The bacon on this burger had the texture of beef jerky and looked like it was heated with a hair dryer and then somebody spilled red paint on it. The bun was about 2 minutes away from breaching the stale barrier.  It's dryness was cough inducing. The patty, or more accurately the carbon based black mass of sadness smushed between the stale buns of depression came in second place to gypsum board as the restaurant's most flavorless substance. I ordered the microwaved steak fries with my burger and my wife order the exact same fries but with the heading "garlic fries" where said garlic was carelessly sprinkled onto the surface of a single fry. Tada! Item variety.  Never going back.
I'm here now service is horrible and the food is substandard. We waited 15 mins for a table and it  was in self setting area.

Loved the free shake for royalty members :) Also my server Felycie was one of the better servers I've had in awhile! The host was kind of a bad host though. She would call the people that were waiting up from their seats only to say hold on she'll be right with them and then keep doing whatever she was doing before

First off, had the best server ever. I believe her name was Cat, she was amazing, had us laughing throughout lunch. By far one of my favorite places to get burgers. We decided to try the burning love, but with a veggie patty, so tasty and delicious. And did I mention it comes with bottomless fries. :)  Decided to share with my friend, cause I never can finish one on my own. Also tried the campfire sauce, recommended by our server, which was a mixture of ranch and bbq, i think. Whatever it was, it goes great with there steak fries. Lastly can't forget about their drinks. Had a variety of shakes, smoothies, and lemonades. I tried the mint brownie shake, which was heaven. My friend tried the Hawaiian Heart  Throb smoothie, which cam in a funky twisty glass, very refreshing and great during summer.  Can't wait to try the other burgers and there mud pie, which sound amazing :)

To say I love Red Robin is an understatement. 9 times out of 10, if I get to choose where we go out to eat, I choose Red Robin.... It's out of control. After moving to Corona last year, we went to the location on McKinley a couple times, and it was just terrible every time. Food was bad, service was bad... we vowed never to go back.  Remembering that they opened a new Red Robin at Tyler, we decided to make the slightly farther drive over to check it out. This Red Robin location (at Tyler) is hands down the best one I have been to. The service is always great. The employees have all been very friendly, and the food is by far better than at any other red robin. The burgers are flavorful, it always comes out in good time, and always hot and fresh. I really cannot understand how anyone can complain, as this is not just a review I am making after one visit, we have been at least 10 times in the last 9 months. I refuse to go to McKinley location, even though that is so much closer to home. I will drive the extra 5 miles here any day.

Kristal was our server and she was fantastic as usual!!! Every time we come she assists us and every single time she is amazing! She is kind and caring. She even went above and beyond for my sisters birthday and gave us a big piece of cake for all of us to share. She did not have to do that but she did and this is why she is the best!!! Thank you Kristal for being fabulous we will definitely be back to this red robin because of the fantastic service we received and continue to receive every time we come!!!!!!
Food is great as usual and server good, but margarita's in Bar area water down for the price.we had three and it more better to buy our own from Costco.

Had reservations for a party of 20 on a Sunday evening. We were seated 35 minutes after our reservation time. After being seated, I had to get up and go find a manger as we were seated over 10 minutes and had yet to give our drink orders. The service was horrible! We received appetizers before our drinks. I understand 20 is a large party, if they cant handle a group that size perhaps they shouldn't accept the business.
great burgers, great service, they are super busy though, dont be sensitive. i love coming here. great for family. wish they were  open a lil bit longer. they close at 11pm weekdays.

So We had dinner here Friday night 9/25/15 and I ordered a ceaser chicken wrap an i started to eat my fist piece an I choked on a date sticker they Lao I gag it back up an I took it out of my mouth it was disgusting an I have it to the manager or whoever he was an he said I'll make u a new one sorry we won't charge u for this wrap like seriously I just choked on this had to gag it out I had no more appetite this was horrible that has never happened to me before so be careful with the extras they add in the food especially if kids are eating there that's scary

good place to get a burger and bottomless fries. The service varies from time to time, some servers are better than others but hey that is everywhere you go. Parking can be brutal because of it's location at the mall but it is a nice set up. the price is right and the food has always been good. i have been here a few times and will continue to stop by and enjoy lunch on occassion. if you happen to be in the area stop by and give them a try.

What can I say? This place had me at "Hello".   It's mainly because Red Robin is the only chain (that I'm aware of) that offers a burger with fried egg on top (the Red Robin Royal Burger). And as anyone who knows me know that I am a huge egg fanatic! Other things I love on the menu are the French Onion soup and the Garlic Fries and Sweet Potato Fries, both of which are unlimited here! I only wish they had better shakes. The shakes are a bit watered down compared to Ruby's, but the burgers are definitely better here.

I've been here a few times since it opened. I feel like this restaurant was the first one to start with the bigger beverage glasses. It makes the sugary drinks more enjoyable. I came here for a birthday party with 10+ people. Almost everyone ordered an entree with fries. So, I assumed that the unlimited fries would start rolling in. One of the kids at our table would ask for a fry refill, but we would only get 1 basket. That's a little unsettling when there are 6 kids in one table. You can't expect a fry basket to last very long or for all the kids to share. Other than that comment, one of the other servers was very accomodating. The salad entrees got smaller, but the food tasted great, and everyone had a great time.

I usually don't do reviews on big chain eateries unless there is something extremely negative or overwhelmingly positive about the experience.  With Red Robins, however, I just can't resist.  Favorite burger chain ever! I've enjoyed many of their different burgers, and never had a bad experience with any of them. For something different and tasty, may I suggest the Royal Red Robin: the burger is topped with a fried egg.  Season it with their house seasoning, and the taste is out of this world.   Combine that with the bottomless steak fries, decent prices, and fun atmosphere, and you're always in for a treat!

I'm pretty thrown off by the reviews! I must have been lucky or whatever the case maybe! The service was amazing and so was my waiters she was helpful by pointing out all the veggie dishes. Since I am vegetarian. On the side note there drinks are amazing! However, they might want to turn up the music. Other than that I won't complain. I had garden burger with fires on the side! For drinks I gold margarita peach flavor and signature sliver partón! Overall, five star experience! :)

This location is horrible. Ordered some burgers to go and was told it would be done in 10 minutes. Came in 20 minutes and was told they didn't get an ordered and that I must have gotten the wrong location. OK so I reordered told that my order would be done in 10 minutes. Which is already 30 and still no burgers or apologies. Will never be coming to this location again.

Felt a little rushed by the server. We weren't finished with our dinner and checks were already brought. We heard the same coming from him at a different table. Food was great so thanks chef! But the service was awful, so thanks for rushing us Matt. The sooner we were out, the better.

This place deserves a 5 star because of the service. We arrived during lunch time on a Friday and were seated promptly, our server was amazing very attentive and gave us exactly what we ordered. The food is great, and I really liked that they added more healthier sides in the kids menu. I really enjoyed the time I spent there with my family and would definitely come back again.

Generally I love Red Robin and I've never had a problem at any of their restaurants until I ate at this one a few days ago. I sat at a table in the bar with my cousin and her girlfriend and it was a Saturday night so it was understandably busy, but I really can't see how that excuses our waitress from ever stopping to check on our table or even pick up our bill when she walked by every few minutes. After we ordered and finished eating, we literally waited almost a half hour before a manager walked by, heard my cousin complaining, and then finally told our waitress to bring us the bill. Then we waited another ten minutes before actually receiving, and at least another ten before she took it back to the computer. Unbelievable. And by the time we had finished eating, the bar area really wasn't busy anyway.  The food was fine (California Chicken Burger every time, mmm) but I was really disappointed by this experience. I'd have a hard time coming back to this location.

Omg. This is the second time I have had a problem with this red robin. The first time my husband ordered a salad and I asked for no bacon since my husband doesnt eat pork and they put bacon on it. This time I ordered a salad and they didnt give me any dressing, my lettuce was brown, my clam chowder soup was very runny I couldnt even eat it. My husbands chicken was cold. I called the manager and she offered a gift card but to me that wasnt that much compensation because I wasted money. I couldnt even eat my food so I had to go back out and waste more money. Terrible service
I've always been a big fan of Red Robin. The food is always up to par, but at this Red Robin, the service was extremely slow. 20 minutes before we even got our drinks.

What can I say but I had the best waiter this evening he was so helpful when we ordered and getting our drinks to us and we didn't have to ask for refills he was on top of that. Our food was very yummy and not to mention the fact we got unlimited fries was the best. We were a party of 7 including three children. Now with kids it's a little tough to have them sit and eat and of course not be loud. But our waiter was very patient and bought them crayons and drinks to keep them happy.

I have no idea why Red Robin has 4 stars. I wish I could give it 0 stars.This was the worst meal that I've ever paid for. My sisters birthday dinner and she ordered the crispy chicken sandwich. She said she would have rather went through the Wendy's drive through. I ordered a garden burger and it tasted like they microwaved it and it was all soggy. My mom ordered the French onion soup and she took one bite and pushed it to the side. The only good thing was the fries but calling them "bottomless" is false advertising because our waitress lagged on the refills. Thoroughly dissatisfied.
Great food and service even though they were very busy. Freddie is the best server we have had at this location. Great attitude.

I went in there Monday after Valentines day. My friend and I walked into the bar like we always do since it is open seating. We sat for a while waiting to be helped, the manager was at the next table over chatting, after a while she asked us if we were doing okay. we told her we needed menus and drinks. she goes and get menus and then walks away. doesn't even get a drink order. I finally hit the call server button on that computer thing they put on the tables. and the Bartender finally came over.  almost 5 minutes after our appetizer came out our entrees come. the bartender never once came to check on us to see if we needed refills or if our food was even correct.  she came and then cleared our plates and walked away. by this time we were angry and just wanted to pay and leave.  she never came back to ask if we wanted dessert or our check. i know that computer thing is on the table to pay with but we wanted to pay cash. so we just left it on the table.
